title: Phase 2: Win32 Hooks Implementation
description:
Implement keyboard hook and foreground detector with thread-safe event publishing.

## Tasks
1. Keyboard Hook Implementation (KeyPilot.Hooks/KeyboardHook.cs):
   - SetWindowsHookEx(WH_KEYBOARD_LL) on dedicated STA thread
   - Message pump with GetMessage/DispatchMessage
   - Thread-safe event publishing via Channel<ModifierKeyEventArgs>
   - Detect Ctrl/Alt/Shift/Win (L/R variants)
   - Implement IKeyboardHook from Core

2. Foreground Detector Implementation (KeyPilot.Hooks/ForegroundDetector.cs):
   - Timer-based polling (250ms) for GetForegroundWindow
   - QueryFullProcessImageName via Win32 API
   - Only raise event when process name changes
   - Graceful fallback for elevated processes
   - Implement IForegroundDetector from Core

3. Win32 P/Invoke Declarations (KeyPilot.Hooks/Win32/NativeMethods.cs):
   - SetWindowsHookEx, UnhookWindowsHookEx, CallNextHookEx
   - GetForegroundWindow, GetWindowThreadProcessId
   - QueryFullProcessImageName, OpenProcess, CloseHandle
   - GetMessage, DispatchMessage, PeekMessage

4. Lifecycle Management:
   - Proper cleanup on Dispose/StopAsync
   - UnhookWindowsHookEx guaranteed via finally blocks
   - Unhandled exception handler for emergency cleanup

## Validation
- Keyboard hook detects all modifier key presses/releases
- Hook thread does NOT block (verify with Thread.Sleep in callback)
- Foreground detector polls at ~250ms intervals
- Elevated processes handled without crash (fallback to _global)
- All resources released on StopAsync
- CPU usage < 0.5% when idle

SQLite Schema:
CREATE TABLE UsageEvents (
    Id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
    ShortcutId TEXT NOT NULL,
    ProfileName TEXT NOT NULL,
    Timestamp TEXT NOT NULL
);
CREATE INDEX IX_UsageEvents_ShortcutId ON UsageEvents(ShortcutId);

title: Phase 4: Adaptive Learning Engine
description:
Implement ranking algorithm that combines frequency, recency, and static weights.

## Tasks
1. Ranking Algorithm (KeyPilot.Core/AdaptiveRanker.cs):
   - Score = (Frequency * freqWeight) + (Recency * recencyWeight) + StaticWeight
   - Frequency: count of usage in last N days
   - Recency: days since last use (inverted, with decay)
   - Decay function: exponential decay over configured days
   - Configurable weights from settings

2. Cache Strategy:
   - Ranked results cached per profile
   - Cache invalidated on new usage event
   - LRU cache with max 10 profiles
   - Cache TTL: 5 minutes

3. Performance Optimization:
   - Compiled queries for SQLite
   - Batch reading of usage events
   - Avoid N+1 queries

## Validation
- Frequently used shortcuts rank higher
- Recent usage boosts ranking
- Static weight provides base ranking
- Cache improves performance (>50% cache hit rate)
- Rankings update within 100ms of usage event

title: KeyPilot Implementation
description:
Windows shortcut learning assistant built with .NET 8, WinUI 3, and modern C# patterns. Shows context-aware keyboard shortcut overlays triggered by modifier keys.

## Architecture
5 source projects + 3 test projects:
- KeyPilot.App: WinUI 3 entry point, DI composition root
- KeyPilot.Core: Domain models, interfaces (NO framework deps)
- KeyPilot.Hooks: Win32 keyboard hook, foreground app detector
- KeyPilot.Data: SQLite (Dapper) usage DB, JSON profile loader
- KeyPilot.UI: Pages, ViewModels (CommunityToolkit.Mvvm), overlay windows

## Performance Targets
- Modifier overlay visible: <30ms
- Cheatsheet overlay open: <50ms
- CPU idle: <2%
- Memory RSS: <150MB

Tech Stack: .NET 8, WinUI 3, CommunityToolkit.Mvvm, H.NotifyIcon.WinUI, Dapper, Serilog
